markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 9"
    pfs=""
>
[Hunter's Hagbook](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1709)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
<trait label="Grimoire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=387" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #182: Graveclaw](/Sources.aspx?ID=143) pg. 77</row>

**Price** 700 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This magical book has its official title, _The Grimoire of Lady Jayne Cutter_, written on an inside page in illuminated letters. Among occultists and other scholars, it's known by its colloquial name: the _Hunter's Hagbook_. The book is a grimoire created and used by a legendary Varisian monster hunter. The _Hunter's Hagbook_ can hold 100 spells but the following spells are always present in the book, can't be removed from it, and count against the total: [_blind eye_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1213), [_blood duplicate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1214), [_caster's imposition_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1215), [_hag's fruit_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1216), [_ritual obstruction_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1217), [_web of influence_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1218)

 When you attempt a saving throw against a [coven](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=11) spell, you can immediately end the duration of a spell affecting you that you prepared from this book. If you do, the result of your saving throw is one degree of success better than your roll (for example, a critical failure becomes a failure).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Hunter's Hagbook

Among occultists and other scholars, it's known by its colloquial name: the Hunter's Hagbook . The book is a grimoire created and used by a legendary Varisian monster hunter. The Hunter's Hagbook can hold 100 spells but the following spells are always present in the book, can't be removed from it, and count against the total: blind eye , blood duplicate , caster's imposition , hag's fruit , ritual obstruction , web of influence When you attempt a saving throw against a coven spell, you can immediately end the duration of a spell affecting you that you prepared from this book.
